name: Hotel Park Bergen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Great for climbers

reviews.text: unique small hotel; excellent room; heated bathroom floor; strong wifi; good breakfast; coffee/treats throughout the day; helpful, kind staff; good bed and special decor.
reviews.title: nice hotel in good location for reasonable price

reviews.text: Not-so-positives:
reviews.title: Cosy and clean Hotel Park Pension

reviews.text: up a long hill from town; no elevator and steep, twisting stairway; away from major attractions as well as restaurants.
reviews.title: Value for money in central location

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay and were pleased with the Park, but we would probably stay closer to town, at the bottom of the hill, next time.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in the middle of a charming city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charming place, perfectly located within walking distance of the Natural History Museum and all other attractions of super charming Bergen. Room was pretty cool, on a corner overlooking an intersection where we could watch junkies entering and leaving the park. Oh, did I say junkies?
reviews.title: Charming, I guess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not saying there are problems in and around this park; it's probably like many parks all over the world with a varied user population. I would just stress the word user above. If you are not looking for it, you may not see it. Just be aware that it is there.
reviews.title: Not for Seniors

likes.liked: — Traditional decor, breakfast, and service. Also low price.

reviews.text: I wasn't impressed by the breakfast and did not find the staff to be super friendly. And the carpets could have stood better vacuuming. But we liked the hotel and found the location to be near perfect.
reviews.title: Spend your money elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not prepared for the steepness of the climb to the hotel and then they put us on the third floor. Because there are no stores, restaurants, etc. nearby, everything required a trip down and up the hill and stairs. The staff were helpful, the breakfast good, and the rooms clean. The only nearby attraction is the natural and cultural history museums.
reviews.title: Good for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As already mentioned in the other reviews the hotel is located somewhat outside the city center in a residential area. Advantage is that you have free parking space available and that the area is rather quiet (this is however not the case on Saturday nights where all the young folks around the are seem to celebrate the soccer results, get out their ghetto blasters and make noise late into the night). Walking to downtown should take around 20 to 25 minutes. Going by car to downtown is OK as well -- parking in Bergen was not nearly as expensive as in Oslo.
reviews.title: I wouldn't stay here again...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a great 3 days staying here at the Hotel Park Pension. It is in the University district, 5 minutes from the bus and train station and 5 minutes walk to the centre i.e. fish market/harbour.
reviews.title: Cannot beat this place

likes.liked: — Spacious room, good location, good decor, clean
likes.disliked: — separate bathroom (although it was private to our room)

reviews.title: Town Hideaway
reviews.text: We stayed in the annex across the road. Only downside was that the bathroom although private, was separate from the room. Breakfast was included, very european (cheese, bread, ham, tea coffee etc) but all very welcome.

reviews.title: Pleasant hotel
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again. People were very friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel had excellent reviews in both our german travel guidebooks. So I made a booking for a double room on the phone. We arrived late in the afternoon just to find out that this "romantic" hotel indeed has a nice lobby area but that our room was only 10 square meters big and was located in the basement with a view into a dark inner courtyard. I am talking about room 015 in the building across the street right next to the breakfast room. They charge you 165 US$ for this.
reviews.title: Prison Cell Rooms

likes.disliked: — The value for money is not good (165 US$ for a prison cell size room in the basement)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course they must have much nicer rooms but we had to spend the night in the small basement room since by the time we arrived all other decent hotels were already booked out.
reviews.title: Nothing special
One of the best places I have EVER stayed!
reviews.text: I can understand that a hotel always has good and not so good rooms. But if they start to convert every broom closet into a "hotel room" then someone should really take the title "romantic hotel" away from them. If you want my advice: if you intend to stay at this hotel make sure that they do not put you in room 014 and 015 (not to be mixed up with 14 and 15 which are across the road in the main buliding). Otherwise you might end up paying 165 US$ for a room that is smaller than a prison cell.

Old-fashioned family-run hotel in a pleasant residential neighborhood ten to fifteen minutes from the harbor and the main tourist hotels. Our room was small but comfortable, with good chairs, reading lights, and a view of the town. Calm; good value. We found the service somewhat dour, though. Breakfast is from 7-9, which means that all the food disappears promptly at 9. A family arriving shortly before the hour were told they were too late and sent away. Note to travelers with impaired mobility: steep stairs and no elevator.
reviews.title: Old-fashioned comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: location is in a nice victorian houses area with many students but calm. a bit out of the city center (10 mn walk).room was furnished with nice old style furniture.good bathroom. lot of charm.to park your car you can pay the hotel 50 nok a day. a good choice. you feel comfortable.
reviews.title: great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel in February, for a 7 night stay in August 2007, based on the excellent reviews here and on other websites- so were a bit concerned to start to see some negative reviews appear since.
reviews.title: Good value and excellent hotel

likes.disliked: — Nothing really - other than breakfast closed at 9.00!

reviews.text: Our experience however was totally positive: excellent quiet location, five minutes from the art galleries and the large lake in central Bergen, and about 10/15 mins from the main tourist centre, the Torget. Location was up a hill - but not really a strenuous walk from the centre.
reviews.title: Definitely Overrated

reviews.text: Our room (112 in the annex) was very comfortable, clean and well decorated. Shower room only but that was efficient. The hotel ambience was very good - interesting art and artifacts all over the place - not at all a boring standard euro-american hotel.
reviews.title: Adequate at best with small rooms

likes.disliked: — Rooms were poor and not that clean

description: Hotel Park Bergen is a family owned hotel, known for its particular personal style and pleasant atmosphere. If you would like to experience something which is different from the large chain hotels then Hotel Park is definitely worth a visit. Hotel Park is a member of the association “Historic Hotels and Restaurants” which consists of nearly 50 of Norway’s most charming hotels and restaurants, each offering its own individual character and distinctive features.
